key_points: Suez Canal officials plan to widen and deepen a stretch of the waterway to prevent future blockages like the one in March.
This expansion involves widening the canal by 131 feet and deepening it by 32 feet.
Organizations are encouraged to learn from past crises and implement reforms to prevent recurrence.
Example given of Starbucks' response to a racial bias incident by conducting anti-bias training for employees.
The U.S. Secret Service has faced criticism for a perceived lack of transparency and accountability in crisis situations.
Secret Service responds to criticisms by highlighting organizational and policy changes made in response to past incidents.
Improvements include better communication, clear articulation of budget needs, increased hiring, and more training.
An independent review following a White House fence-jumping incident led to 19 recommendations for the Secret Service.
Organizations are advised to use resolved crises as opportunities for improvement through after-action reviews.
Debriefing after a crisis is crucial, but it needs clear leadership support and understanding of its purpose.
spokespersons: Jonathan Wackrow (Former Agent, U.S. Secret Service)
